article.headline: Compass Pathways to raise up to $107.2 million in IPO
article.body: Compass Pathways PLC CMPS, -9.16% sets terms of its initial public offering, as the U.K.-based mental health care company looks to raise up to $107.2 million, and to value the company at about $544.1 million. Compass is offering 6.7 million American Despositary Shares (ADS) in the IPO, which is expected to price between $14 and $16 a share. There will be 34.01 million ordinary shares outstanding after the IPO; each ADS represents one ordinary share. The stock is expected to list on the Nasdaq under the ticker symbol "CMPS." Cowen, Evercore ISI and Berenberg are the joint book-running managers. For the six months ended June 30, the company recorded a net loss of $24.8 million on no revenue, after a loss of $6.3 million on no revenue in the same period a year ago. The company is looking to go public at a good time that the Renaissance IPO ETF IPO, +1.98% has rallied 27.1% over the past three months and the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% has gained 9.9%.
